conbody.p: A memory store is a non-persistent store and is implemented entirely within RAM.
It implements many of the operations defined by the store abstract framework; existing streams within the store can be changed.
Specifically, streams in a memory store can be:

li.p: created in advance of being written to

conbody.p: Overwriting an existing stream can result in a shorter stream; however, a stream cannot be extended beyond its original length. Replacing a stream can result in a stream which is longer or shorter than the original.
The order in which streams are written to a memory store is not important as streams can be changed and rewritten.
The CBufStore class encapsulates an in-memory non-persistent store.
